bill_title: allow the Department of Public Safety to regulate installers of manufactured homes and to allow the department to establish an installation inspection program.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the Department of Public Safety to regulate installers of manufactured homes and to allow the department to establish an installation inspection program. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may require that manufactured homes with a manufacturer's statement of origin be installed by a licensed installer. The department shall allow a homeowner to install his or her own manufactured home but may require the homeowner to have such installation inspected by a certified inspector. Section 2. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may license installers of manufactured homes. The department may promulgate rules pursuant to chapter 1-26 to provide for the qualifications for licensure and the procedure to be used for licensure. The department may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, establish a licensure fee not to exceed one hundred dollars. The license expires two years after its issuance and may be renewed by complying with the renewal requirements, and paying the renewal fee, as established by the department in rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26. Section 3. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, provide for an installation inspection program to ensure that licensees are complying with installation standards. The program may include provisions that allow an installer to conduct an inspection of the installer's own work. However, if the department receives more than three complaints within a calendar year, that the department determines to be valid, the department may eliminate the installer's right to inspect the installer's own work. Section 4. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, require licensed installers to have proof of contractor's liability insurance in an amount not less than one hundred thousand dollars, and may require this insurance policy to contain a provision for the immediate notification of the department upon cancellation. Section 5. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, require licensed installers to have a letter of credit, certificate of deposit issued by a licensed financial institution, or surety bond issued by an authorized insurer in the amount of ten thousand dollars for the performance of installation pursuant to the manufacturer's installation instructions. The department may require immediate notification of the department upon cancellation. Section 6. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may certify manufactured home installer inspectors. The department may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, provide for the qualifications of certified manufactured home installer inspectors. The department may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, establish a certification fee not to exceed one hundred dollars. The certification expires two years after issuance and may be renewed by complying with the renewal requirements, and paying the renewal fee, as established by the department in rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26. Section 7. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, prescribe an installation insignia and establish an insignia fee not to exceed fifty dollars for each insignia. The insignia shall be placed on a home in a location as prescribed by the department to indicate that the manufactured home was installed in accordance with manufacturer's installation instructions. Section 8. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, adopt a procedure to receive and investigate complaints concerning the installation of manufactured homes and determine if such complaints are valid. If a manufactured home installation complaint is determined to be valid, the department may require the installer to pay for the repairs to bring the installation into compliance and for costs associated with complaint inspection and subsequent inspections. Section 9. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may, by rules promulgated pursuant to chapter 1-26, establish criteria to suspend, revoke, or not renew an installer's license or an inspector's certification. Any installer or inspector may appeal the suspension, revocation, or nonrenewal of a license or certification in accordance with chapter 1-26. Section 10. That chapter 34-34A be amended by adding thereto a NEW SECTION to read as follows: The Department of Public Safety may enter into joint agreements with other agencies in other states to administer a licensure program or an installation inspection program.
